title: 8 months and counting
body:
So 8 months ago i think we can all remember, all league lore was made non-canon.

Honestly to anyone that was ever invested in the lore in any way it was a kick in the teeth, and honestly at this point the game makes 0 sense as a whole because of this change.

Now in 8 months we have had a few videos.

That's fucking pathetic Rito, lets be honest, you delete everything lore wise, and make no effort to even try to make lore, you just make a few videos WHICH COULD HAVE EASILY BEEN MADE WITHOUT THE LORE DELETION.

If we are being honest, the main reason for the lore deletion was for less effort.

Here's something out of the article saying lore was non-canon.

>At a very broad level, we’ve decided to push League’s story beyond its original focus on explaining in-game action and forge a new narrative path for Runeterra – a world in which the factions and champions we all know and love have full freedom to grow, travel, and kick ass on a worldwide scale.

This is a load of shit, there is maybe 10 champions that have anything about them in this, and most of these are NEW champions not old (which could have easily been done WITH the old lore)

So come on Rito, either admit you were doing this because you were lazy fucks that couldn't be bothered with the lore, or actually do what you guys actually said you would.

replies.body:
I've still yet to see anything that says "All the lore is now null and void LOLOLOLOLOLOL"
From what I've seen all the champion lore is still relevant and has meaning.


Also if you've ever payed any attention to the lore, you'll realise it's been nothing but an inconsistent cluster fuck. Half the champions come from "another world" and those worlds are never explained in any way.
A good example is Nasus and Renekton, with the lore rework for Shurima it grounded them within tangible reality instead of "lololol deus ex machina is inserted here".


You say Riot are putting less effort into lore? I'm pretty sure it takes more effort to produce an animated feature than it does to write two paragraphs of text.
So yeah, Riot's being totally lazy with the lore.

>I've still yet to see anything that says "All the lore is now null and void LOLOLOLOLOLOL"
From what I've seen all the champion lore is still relevant and has meaning.

This is the downvoted comment of one of the rioters in the Dev blog in question

>Good question!

>No, Summoners, the Fields of Justice and the Institute are not canon within the fictional world of Runeterra. In-game, players are still referred to as summoners - but summoners won't be part of the story.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/creative-spotlight/dev-blog-exploring-runeterra

Go here scroll down and you'll see the first downvoted rito comment and this is it.

The lore isn't canon.

>Half the champions come from "another world" and those worlds are never explained in any way.

Can't tell what world's your refering to, but most are at least somewhat explained. (except the void i believe.)

>You say Riot are putting less effort into lore? I'm pretty sure it takes more effort to produce an animated feature than it does to write two paragraphs of text.

Dude how many videos have you seen in the 8 months?

Back when JoJ ran it was actually articles of stuff quite fucking often, instead we get SHITTY videos that explain shit all really, for 10 champions.

The rest of the champions?

They aren't even canon.


If they did more then a sentence and a video for the champs they did once every few months i wouldn't have a problem, but honestly, most of what is now actually canon, is the new champions rather then the old.

So you've never paid attention to Renekton, Nasus, Kayle, Morgana, Taric and others coming from other world, or another land, or from far away in space?
The void is an actual place within League's reality, unlike the unexplained worlds that the champs I just mentioned came from.


The Institute of War no longer being canon doesn't suddenly make Lissandra, Ashe and Sejuani not hate each other. It doesn't suddenly make Graves no longer have a beef with Twisted Fate. It doesn't remove the lore of Warwic tricking Soraka into giving up her divine immortality.
Leona and Diana are still the bodily marks of the Sun and Moon.

The champion lore isn't suddenly non-canon. It still exists. The champions still have their reasons for existing. Nowhere has it been said that Ashe is no longer Ashe, Annie can't be Annie anymore, Viktor can't Viktor.


Anyone who actually pays attention to stories and knows how to weigh them will know that the Institute of War was quite a Deus Ex Machina.

From what has been said all you can deduce is that Runeterra is still Runeterra, painted just as it was with all the old champion lore, but with shit that makes it inconsistent being removed such as the Institute of War, champions coming from other worlds deep in space (Renekton/Nasus/Kayle/Morgana/etc) are now coming from places in Runeterra.



You are ranting over shit as if you've been told that 100% everything you ever knew about something has been deleted forever, when in reality you've only been told that what makes the thing you know schizophrenic is being removed.



Maybe it's just me, but the Shurima event videos tieing the lore of what, eight champions together in two videos and explaining their relationship that way is pretty damn cleaver and fulfilling. But then again I had a fair bit of grievance with the lore of a lot of those champions, so I'm somewhat bias in liking that they are cleaner now.

Sion's complete overhaul was fan-fucking-tastic. I shouldn't need to say more here.

Taric's been slated for a rework, so I expect his lore will be updated then, I wont have to take issue with him being randomly teleported to Runeterra from a distant unknown land.

Urgot is slated for a Sion level rework, so expect some awesome shit from that.

I expect Kayle and Morgana's lore to be updated in the future, so that they don't come from Space Heaven/Hell.

Now lets see, for the majority of the champions left over you can easily just remove any mention of THE FIELDS OF JUSTICE and THE INSTITUTE OF WAR and their lore will be perfectly fine.
Except Nocturne, he'll need some lore update.






But what would I know eh? I'm just some nerd who outside of University studies loves to wrap himself in books, and video game stories/worlds.

I definitely think they should make the lore better and put more effort into it but that would delay alot of game features (if lore came soon or first), maybe even a stroy mode.. taking you through every hero (s) and villains story.. like what happened with shen's dad/master. but that is a massive stretch
the game doesn't need to make sense.
But it doesn't need to not make sense, in fact it's made sense up until 8 months ago with this change.

On NA, this very same issue is brought up weekly. If not from a rage post then it's from an intelligent piece.

Guess how much Riot has responded, or at least in any comprehensible or logical manner?

I know that for a game about a bunch of people bashing each other's face in, things don't have to make any sense. But when you consider that the lore used to okay, not the best thing ever but certainly serviceable and somewhat innovative in its own right, and the fact fighting games (which is really where we would give out a free pass on the story section) nowadays have better stories and lores. 

Then you know Riot really can/should do better when everything now is just a pure blank, either give us something or revert the recton, make up your mind already.
I just wanna know what happened to Marcus.
I'm still laughing at the fact Amumu's lore is now a sentence long.
I'll be fair on them, it's a sentence and a shitty video.
Must say i find it funny that some uneducated people are downvoting this because they don't know about the retcon.
